instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi iv got a [URL="tel:<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>"]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL] board it?s I know but customer is happy to pay 
I?m not getting green light 
iv got 
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> present 
<SIGNAL>PPUS_G3</SIGNAL> 12.58 present 
charger acin 
charger acok 
checked <RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7061</RESISTOR> all ok all are present 
any advise please

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
First of all, check resistance to ground at L6995 (ohm scale).
If get less than 30K, MCP is probably dead.

For green light, test another Magsafe board.
Post <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>/01 voltages and check continuity from <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> to Magsafe central pin.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6900</CHIP> pin one is 3.4v 
tested second MagSafe still the same this is good MagSafe 
l6995 ohm I get reading of 5.322 k on my multimeter 
<CHIP>U6900</CHIP> pin 5 there is continuity to MagSafe central pin

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You didn't post voltage for pins 4 & 5 of <CHIP>U6900</CHIP>.
You may get Magsafe light at the end, but such low value on 3V42 rail makes me believe you are wasting the time...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Bad MCP RIP waste of time
